channel.title: The Hon. Mitch McConnell
channel.description: The Hon. Mitch McConnell U.S. Senate Republican Leader, Kentucky (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Ladies and Gentlemen.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: We're here this week for the simple reason that our nation is in desperate need of leadership.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: And we believe Mitt Romney is the man for the moment.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: That's the hopeful message coming from Tampa this week: after four long years, help is on the way.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: America is about to turn the page on Barack Obama's four-year experiment in big government.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: And it starts by renewing our belief that we're called to something better.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Over the past four years Americans have been led to believe we're just like everybody else, that America isn't unique.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: But it's not true.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: We are different.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Not because of where we were born, but because of who we are as a people.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Because of what we have in here.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: The President scoffs at this idea. To him, this kind of thinking is the problem, not the solution. That's why he's spent the last four years lowering Americans' expectations instead of raising them.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: That's why he's been missing in action on the greatest challenges of the day.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: What this administration has in mind for America isn't a renewal, it's a great leveling out. It wants the kind of government-imposed equality that in a single generation transformed Western Europe from a place where for centuries high achievement and discovery and innovation were celebrated and prized, to a place where they have elections about whether people should have to work.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Where they make promises they can't keep and write checks they can't cash.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: But that's not who we are.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: It just doesn't occur to an American that someone else will solve their problems.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Americans take pride in solving problems for themselves.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: And if we fail, we get back up and try again.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: It's what we do. It's who we are.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: This President may want to give up on the problems we face, manage the decline.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: But the American people don't.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: And that's why this election is so important. It's a choice about who we are.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Are we still a country that takes risks, that innovates, that believes anything is possible?
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Or are we a country that is resigned to whatever liberty the government decides to dish out?
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: I tell students all the time the only way to fail in America is to quit.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: I truly believe that. And I know Mitt Romney does too.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: For four years, Barack Obama has been running from the nation's problems.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: He hasn't been working to earn reelection. He's been working to earn a spot on the PGA tour.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Mitt Romney has spent his entire life finding ways to solve problems.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Mitt Romney has never been resigned to what someone else said was possible.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: He cut his own path.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: That's why he believes in his heart that America has a future full of opportunity and hope.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: And that's why when Mitt Romney looks down the road, he sees a country that's ready for a comeback. I firmly believe he's the man to lead it.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: As we meet here tonight, America is suffering through an economic calamity of truly historic dimensions. Some are calling it the slowest recovery in our nation's entire 236-year history.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: To call this a recovery is an insult to recoveries.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: This is not the result of forces beyond our control. It is not the result of some sinister political plot; as some of the more paranoid inhabitants of the left-wing fever swamps would have you believe.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: It is the result of the policies that Barack Obama and his Democratic allies in Congress spent two full years carefully putting into place, and which they are determined to continue, if they win again.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Policies that are meant to gently lull us into a state of lower expectations and diminished dreams.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: We've gotten a preview of this future over the past few years.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: We hear the stories every day now.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: ...the father who puts on a suit every morning and leaves the house so his daughter doesn't know he lost his job.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: ...the recent college grad facing up to the painful reality that the only door that's open to her after four years of study and a pile of debt is her parents'.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: These are the faces of the Obama economy.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: And this is America's future if we don't do something to change the course this President seems perfectly content to leave us on.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Think about it.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: On the same day we learned that unemployment went up in 44 out of 50 states last month, the President of the United States took to the airwaves to tell the people of Albuquerque that he enjoys green chile, but prefers red.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: We know what the President's got on his iPod, but we don't know what he plans to do about a looming tax hike that could trigger yet another serious recession that would result in even more Americans losing their jobs.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Ladies and Gentlemen: America cannot afford another four years of this.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: For four years, Americans have waited for the faintest light to flicker at the end of the tunnel. And this President has let them down again and again and again.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: It is time to move on.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: It is time for a leader who will lead.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: That leader is Mitt Romney.
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell

item.title: Thank you!
item.author: The Hon. Mitch McConnell
